case_vignette:
A 17-year-old girl is brought to the physician for the evaluation of fatigue for the past 6 months. During this period, she has had a 5-kg (11-lbs) weight loss. She states that she has no friends. When she is not in school, she spends most of her time in bed. She has no history of serious illness. Her mother has major depressive disorder. She appears pale and thin. She is at 25th percentile for height, 10th percentile for weight, and 20th percentile for BMI; her BMI is 19.0. Her temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 65/min, and blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg. Examination shows dry skin, brittle nails, and calluses on the knuckles. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 12.3 g/dL
Serum
Na+ 133 mEq/L
Cl- 90 mEq/L
K+ 3.2 mEq/L
HCO3- 30 mEq/L
Ca+2 7.8 mg/dL
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.

I've been feeling really tired for the past 6 months, and I've also lost about 11 pounds without trying.
Have you been experiencing any abdominal pain or discomfort?
No, I haven't had any abdominal pain or discomfort.

No, I do not have a history of any serious illness.

The case vignette doesn't mention any changes in my bowel habits.
Do you have a family history of gastrointestinal disorders or cancer?
My mother has major depressive disorder, but the vignette doesn't mention any family history of gastrointestinal disorders or cancer.
Are you currently taking any medications? If so, what are they?
The vignette does not provide information about me taking any medications.
**Final Diagnosis:** Gastrointestinal Cancer
